info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:21AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hardin, Massac, Pope, Johnson and Gallatin Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 721 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Uniontown to 7 miles southeast of Harrisburg to 6 miles west of Vienna. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Columbia and Dixon Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 2 and 38. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 40 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southern and southeastern Illinois...southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky.
